lines.text: Alarum. Excursions. Enter PISTOL, French Soldier, and Boy

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Yield, cur!

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: Je pense que vous etes gentilhomme de bonne qualite.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Qualtitie calmie custure me! Art thou a gentleman? what is thy name? discuss.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: O Seigneur Dieu!

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: O, Signieur Dew should be a gentleman: Perpend my words, O Signieur Dew, and mark; O Signieur Dew, thou diest on point of fox, Except, O signieur, thou do give to me Egregious ransom.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: O, prenez misericorde! ayez pitie de moi!

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Moy shall not serve; I will have forty moys; Or I will fetch thy rim out at thy throat In drops of crimson blood.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: Est-il impossible d'echapper la force de ton bras?

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Brass, cur! Thou damned and luxurious mountain goat, Offer'st me brass?

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: O pardonnez moi!

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Say'st thou me so? is that a ton of moys? Come hither, boy: ask me this slave in French What is his name.

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: Ecoutez: comment etes-vous appele?

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: Monsieur le Fer.

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: He says his name is Master Fer.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Master Fer! I'll fer him, and firk him, and ferret him: discuss the same in French unto him.

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: I do not know the French for fer, and ferret, and firk.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Bid him prepare; for I will cut his throat.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: Que dit-il, monsieur?

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: Il me commande de vous dire que vous faites vous pret; car ce soldat ici est dispose tout a cette heure de couper votre gorge.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Owy, cuppele gorge, permafoy, Peasant, unless thou give me crowns, brave crowns; Or mangled shalt thou be by this my sword.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: O, je vous supplie, pour l'amour de Dieu, me pardonner! Je suis gentilhomme de bonne maison: gardez ma vie, et je vous donnerai deux cents ecus.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: What are his words?

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: He prays you to save his life: he is a gentleman of a good house; and for his ransom he will give you two hundred crowns.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Tell him my fury shall abate, and I the crowns will take.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: Petit monsieur, que dit-il?

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: Encore qu'il est contre son jurement de pardonner aucun prisonnier, neanmoins, pour les ecus que vous l'avez promis, il est content de vous donner la liberte, le franchisement.

lines.speaker: french soldier
lines.text: Sur mes genoux je vous donne mille remercimens; et je m'estime heureux que je suis tombe entre les mains d'un chevalier, je pense, le plus brave, vaillant, et tres distingue seigneur d'Angleterre.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Expound unto me, boy.

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: He gives you, upon his knees, a thousand thanks; and he esteems himself happy that he hath fallen into the hands of one, as he thinks, the most brave, valorous, and thrice-worthy signieur of England.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: As I suck blood, I will some mercy show. Follow me!

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: Suivez-vous le grand capitaine. I did never know so full a voice issue from so empty a heart: but the saying is true 'The empty vessel makes the greatest sound.' Bardolph and Nym had ten times more valour than this roaring devil i' the old play, that every one may pare his nails with a wooden dagger; and they are both hanged; and so would this be, if he durst steal any thing adventurously. I must stay with the lackeys, with the luggage of our camp: the French might have a good prey of us, if he knew of it; for there is none to guard it but boys.
Exeunt PISTOL, and French Soldier
Exit
